DataElement.preferredName: Bone Marrow Biopsy Lymphoid Cell Positive Finding Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent the percentage of lymphoid cells involved in a bone marrow biopsy result. [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Bone Marrow Biopsy Lymphoid Cell Involvement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The soft, sponge-like tissue in the center of bones that produces white blood cells, red blood cells, and platelets._Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body._A lymphoid blood-forming cell is a hematopoietic stem cell that is a precursor for a T lymphocyte or B lymphocyte._To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The soft tissue filling the cavities of bones. Bone marrow exists in two types, yellow and red. Yellow marrow is found in the large cavities of large bones and consists mostly of fat cells and a few primitive blood cells. Red marrow is a hematopoietic tissue and is the site of production of erythrocytes and granular leukocytes. Bone marrow is made up of a framework of connective tissue containing branching fibers with the frame being filled with marrow cells (MSH98):Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body.

Concepts.definition: The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.
The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: A lymphoid blood-forming cell is a hematopoietic stem cell that is a precursor for a T lymphocyte or B lymphocyte.:To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

Concepts.definition: A hematopoietic stem cell that is committed to differentiate into T-, B- and natural killer (NK) cells.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid._An observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid. Cells are highly variable and specialized in both structure and function, though all must at some stage replicate proteins and nucleic acids, utilize energy, and reproduce themselves.:An observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.
A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support Lombardi Cancer Center adoption of C3D
